company: The PNC Financial Services Group, Inc.

Transparency.justification: Score = 0.5 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Human Rights Statement - PNC Bank
relevantSources.summary: PNC's human rights statement mentions adherence to six AI principles including transparency, explainability and accuracy.

Transparency.findings: The only available source is PNC's Human Rights Statement, which references transparency as one of six AI principles and notes alignment with OECD guidelines. However, it does not provide concrete details, model cards, or transparency reports specific to AI systems. No public evidence found for detailed or technical transparency disclosures.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 0.5 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Human Rights Statement - PNC Bank
relevantSources.summary: Document outlines PNC's AI principles including diversity, inclusion, fairness, and non-discrimination commitments.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: PNC's Human Rights Statement includes fairness and non-discrimination as part of its AI principles. There is no evidence of published bias mitigation methods, fairness metrics, or third-party fairness audits. The evidence is limited to a broad principle statement.

Explainability.justification: Score = 0.5 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: PNC's Responsible Approach to AI Innovation | Built In
relevantSources.summary: Details PNC's human-in-the-loop approach and dedication to quality assurance in AI systems.

relevantSources.title: PNC Claim Predictor Uses AI to Help Improve Healthcare Operations
relevantSources.summary: Describes PNC's AI-enabled solution for healthcare claim prediction with machine learning technology.

Explainability.findings: Sources mention PNC's human-in-the-loop approach and practical AI implementations, but provide no technical details about explainability methods, tools, or interpretability workflows. The evidence consists of general statements about explainability and quality assurance.

Human Oversight & Accountability.justification: Score = 0.5 because 3 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: PNC's Responsible Approach to AI Innovation | Built In
relevantSources.summary: Explains PNC's human-machine teaming approach with humans as central characters in AI strategy.

relevantSources.title: PNC Technology Outlook: Tech Sector Shows Promise Amid Uncertainty
relevantSources.summary: Discusses human-in-the-loop approaches integrating human involvement with machine learning for desired outcomes.

relevantSources.title: Positioned for growth - PNC Investor Relations
relevantSources.summary: Annual report mentioning PNC's measured approach to AI solutions and governance.

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: The sources reference PNC's human-in-the-loop AI strategy and mention accountability as a principle, but do not describe oversight bodies, appeal processes, or concrete workflows. There is no public evidence of a formal oversight committee or detailed accountability mechanism for AI decisions.

Privacy & Security.justification: Score = 0.5 because 4 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Nonprofits and AI | PNC Insights
relevantSources.summary: Discusses AI data privacy practices and reviewing terms before inputting sensitive information.

relevantSources.title: Deepfakes: Funny Pranks or Disruptive Fraud - PNC Bank
relevantSources.summary: Explains AI-driven deepfakes and their security implications for fraud detection.

relevantSources.title: Staying Safe and Secure: Avoiding Business Scams | PNC Insights
relevantSources.summary: Covers AI-powered cybersecurity threats and defense strategies including generative AI risks.

relevantSources.title: Digital Security Updates - PNC Bank
relevantSources.summary: Details PNC's security enhancements including voice recognition technology and authentication measures.

Privacy & Security.findings: The sources discuss general AI privacy and security risks, such as deepfakes and data protection practices, but do not provide technical details about AI-specific data handling, anonymization, or compliance certifications. Evidence is limited to high-level statements and general security advice.

Governance & Accountability.justification: Score = 0.5 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Human Rights Statement - PNC Bank
relevantSources.summary: Establishes PNC's AI governance framework through six principles including accountability and governance structures.

Governance & Accountability.findings: PNC's Human Rights Statement outlines governance and accountability as AI principles, referencing OECD guidelines, but does not provide evidence of a formal AI governance office, reporting structures, or budget allocations. The available evidence is limited to a high-level policy statement.

Public Commitments & External Audits.justification: Score = 0.5 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain only high-level principle statements.

relevantSources.title: Human Rights Statement - PNC Bank
relevantSources.summary: References alignment with OECD Principles on Artificial Intelligence as external framework commitment.

Public Commitments & External Audits.findings: The Human Rights Statement affirms PNC's commitment to the OECD Principles on Artificial Intelligence, but there is no evidence of published third-party audits, AI certifications, or membership in AI-specific external organizations. The evidence is limited to a stated intention to align with external frameworks.

summary.overallFindings: PNC demonstrates public commitment to responsible AI principles, referencing transparency, fairness, governance, and external frameworks such as the OECD Principles. However, the available evidence is limited to high-level policy statements and general descriptions of human-in-the-loop approaches, with no detailed disclosures, technical documentation, or third-party audits. There is a lack of concrete, verifiable information on actual AI practices, governance structures, or bias mitigation measures. Overall, PNC's Responsible AI disclosures are aspirational rather than operational.
